description: Americans can apply online for the LabCorp test, which costs $119 and works by taking a nasal swab and FedExing the test tube back to the lab. Front-line medical workers with symptoms will be the first priority, but the tests could be available to the general…
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Two cats test positive for coronavirus: how to keep your pets safe
description: Experts now believe animals can get the virus from humans, but say there is little risk of humans getting coronavirus from their pets. The CDC recommends limiting pets’ interactions with other people or animals outside the household and to stay away from them…
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Vaccine agency director says he was removed for questioning hydroxychloroquine
description: Dr. Rick Bright says he was removed from his position as director of a top government vaccine agency after he pressed for a thorough vetting of a coronavirus treatment embraced by President Trump, the drug hydroxychloroquine.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Health care workers speak out amid debate over reopening U.S.
description: Hospitals are fighting an ongoing battle to keep patients alive during the coronavirus pandemic. NBC News’ Gabe Gutierrez hears from health care workers who offer stark warnings of what could happen if the U.S. reopens too soon.
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: New warning of coronavirus second wave amid debate over reopening
description: The head of the CDC warns that a second wave of the coronavirus could coincide with flu season and be “even more difficult.” While President Trump says the director was misquoted, many experts believe the virus will surge again. As concerns grow over what com…
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Georgia tops 20,000 confirmed coronavirus cases as governor moves to reopen
description: One of the nation’s most aggressive reopening measures goes into effect in less than 48 hours, with mixed reactions. Some businesses are choosing not to reopen for fear of spreading the coronavirus, while others welcome the move.
source.name: NBC News

author: David K. Li
title: The only baseball in the world right now is in Taiwan — and they need English broadcasters
description: Taiwan is the only place in the world right now where pro baseball is being played, and the teams are looking for English-speaking announcers.
content:
Baseball's mother tongue is getting a rushed tryout in the only place on Earth where America's pastime is now being played.
Previous play-by-play experience is an appreciated but far from required skill set to get behind the mic at professional baseball game… [+3788 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: Anita Hassan
title: No money, but rent is due: In Colorado, few eviction protections as coronavirus spreads
description: Unlike more than 30 other states, Colorado does not have a statewide moratorium on evictions during the coronavirus outbreak. That's left many tenants fearing they could soon be without homes.
content:
Unlike more than 30 other states, Colorado does not have a statewide moratorium on evictions during the coronavirus outbreak. That's left many tenants fearing they could soon be without homes.

author: Alex Seitz-Wald
title: Trump's home county and other Democratic strongholds ramp up vote-by-mail
description: Miami-Dade, Broward and Palm Beach County in Florida, along with Milwaukee, Wisconsin have decided to send vote-by-mail request forms to every voter.
content: WASHINGTON President Donald Trump's home county in Florida is planning to send vote-by-mail request forms to all of its voters, one of several Democratic population centers in swing states that have taken steps to expand ballot access during the coronavirus c… [+4392 chars]

author: Erika Edwards
title: In sickest COVID-19 patients, underlying conditions are common
description: Who is getting sick with the coronavirus? People with high blood pressure, obesity and diabetes.
content:
People with obesity, diabetes and high blood pressure are at greater risk for complications from the coronavirus, according to a large study of patients hospitalized with the illness it causes.
The findings, published Wednesday in the Journal of the American… [+2266 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: Anita Hassan
title: No money, but rent is due: In Colorado, few eviction protections as coronavirus spreads
description: Colorado Gov. Jared Polis has requested landlords work with tenants on rent payment, but he has not ordered a statewide eviction moratorium during the COVID-19 pandemic, leaving many residents fearing that they could soon be without homes.
content:
In a span of 10 days in March, all three people in Kendra Tallants household lost their jobs.
As the COVID-19 outbreak shut down businesses across Colorado, Tallant, 41, was furloughed from her job at a resort where she took reservations. Her fiancé, who det… [+11051 chars]
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: World Health Organization: COVID-19 ‘will be with us for a long time’
description: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus, the World Health Organization's director-general, warned that coronavirus “will be with us for a long time.”
source.name: NBC News

author: NBCNews.com
title: Colorado renters in limbo over lost wages
description: Governor Jared Polis hasn’t issued a statewide moratorium on evictions, leaving many out-of-work residents worried about their living situations.
source.name: NBC News
